heading: music on the move on the cheap
subheading: vertical horizon uses cd-audio chips, instead of cd-rom technology, to bring down the price -- and the size -- of hybrid cd and mp3 players. by jennifer sullivan.
author: jennifer sullivan
text: vertical horizon is gunning to make the cheapest mp3 gadgets around, including battery-powered headphones that store mp3 files in memory. vertical horizon, based in garden grove, california, has also developed a stereo component and a portable sony discman-like device that plays both regular audio cds and cds burned with mp3 files.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
